metadata.title: CVE-2023-4580 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Push notifications stored on disk in private browsing mode were not beingencrypted potentially allowing the leak of sensitive information. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 117, Firefox ESR < 115.2, and Thunderbird <115.2.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-4580` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:115.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:115.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:115.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:115.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:115.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:115.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:115.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.2').
mozjs78 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs91 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs102 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
